Peter Curtis Lamont (12 November 1929 – 18 December 2020) was a British set decorator, art director, and production designer. He was known for working on many James Bond movies from "Goldfinger" (1964) to "Casino Royale" (2006). He also was the production designer for "Titanic" (1997), winning him an Academy Award.
Lamont died on 18 December 2020 at the age of 91.
